channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: High School Trans Athletes Challenge Trump’s Executive Order in New Hampshire
item.description: A lawsuit appears to be the first challenge to the constitutionality of an executive order barring trans athletes from girls’ and women’s sports teams...

item.title: A 78-year-old pilot was killed after the landing gear on his private jet failed. His wife says he died doing what he loved
item.description: Joie Vitosky was certified as a flight engineer since 1978 and a pilot since 2019.

item.title: Canned Tuna Sold at Trader Joe’s and Costco Is Recalled Over Botulism Risks
item.description: Tuna sold in 26 states and in Washington, D.C., was recalled over concerns that it may have been contaminated. The stores affected include Trader Joe’...

item.title: Hegseth Says Return to Ukraine’s Prewar Borders Is ‘Unrealistic’
item.description: In his first trip abroad, the new U.S. defense secretary told Ukrainian and NATO officials that a durable peace could only come ‘with a realistic asse...

item.title: Some people are obsessed with Papa John’s buttery garlic dipping sauce, so the chain is introducing a limited-edition bath bomb based on the condiment
item.description: Valentine’s Day is going to be a bit…stinky.

item.title: Trump’s small business department fired staff and said it was an accident—then emailed the next day re-firing them
item.description: Probationary staffers reportedly received a series of emails relating to terminations amid widespread headcount cuts in department agencies.

item.title: How Venezuela Helps Feed the Violence in Colombia
item.description: After finding refuge and building power in Venezuela, a decades-old rebel group has waged the worst violence in Colombia in a generation, setting off ...

item.title: How Escalating Violence Is Upending Lives in the West Bank
item.description: Since Oct. 7, 2023, Israeli military raids in areas dominated by Palestinian militants in the West Bank have increased, often leaving civilians with l...

item.title: Exclusive: Legal AI startup Harvey lands fresh $300 million in Sequoia-led round as CEO says on target for $100 million annual recurring revenue
item.description: The three-year-old San Francisco AI startup fetched a $3 billion valuation — double the amount investors valued it at in July.

item.title: Wednesday Briefing: Israel Threatens to End the Cease-Fire
Westminster Dog Show 2025: Unforgettable Dogs Like Monty, Mercedes and Bourbon
item.description: Monty the giant schnauzer took home best in show, but each of the group winners left a lasting impression.

item.title: Rate cuts put on ice as consumer inflation surges to a 9-month high
item.description: “We're really not making progress on inflation right now,” said one economist.

item.title: ‘Ultrahigh Energy’ Neutrino Found With a Telescope Under the Sea
item.description: It’s the most energetic particle of its kind ever discovered, and scientists have no idea where it came from.

item.title: Where the Oscar Race Stands After ‘Emilia Pérez’ Controversy
item.description: “Emilia Pérez” is hobbled, “Anora” is revitalized and plenty remains up in the air ahead of the March 2 awards ceremony.
